text: Hollis Loyd Harris (November 25, 1931 - July 14, 2016) was an American businessman. He served as President and COO of Delta Air Lines (1987-1990) and Chairman, President, and CEO of Continental Airlines (1990-1991), Air Canada (1992-1996), and World Airways (1999-2004).Rachel Tobin Ramos, “Atlanta author fires at Delta succession plan” Atlanta Business Chronicle, July 27, 2006 In 1997, Harris and Steve Wolf signed a strategic agreement between Air Canada and United Airlines, producing what is now the Star Alliance, which grew to become the world's largest global airline alliance. Harris died at the age of 84 on July 14, 2016 in Peachtree City, Georgia. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)
